dmca.title: Linux Gazette Tussle
dmca.body:
Dear Mr. [private]:

This letter is to call to your attention that the domain LinuxGazette.net violates the trademark Linux Gazette of Specialized System Consultants.  While I do not specifically know that you were aware of this at the time of registration, you have been a party to the discussions concerning the mis-use of this name specfiically [sic] related to the linuxgazette.net domain.

Specific examples of our use of this trademark go back to 1996 including sponsorships sold by us to many vendors of Linux-related products and services over the years.  Our use is well-established and under ICANN rules, you must cease this misuse.

I ask that you take the following action:
 * Make the users of this domain aware that they must move to a new domain.
 * Re-assign this domain to Specialized System Consultants, Inc.

The actual users of this domain are also being notified by Specialized System Consultants, Inc. in order to effect an orderly transition and allow them to point to a new URL.

Thank you for your prompt attention.

Sincerely
/s/
[private], President

CC: domainmonger.com
    tucows.com
